titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Frances E. Hilger collection
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by David Jacobs

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-07-03T10:06-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

did.abstract: The Frances E. Hilger collection relates to the political activism of Hilger, an opponent of the Vietnam War. A lifelong Quaker, Hilger participated in several peace groups in the New Jersey area. Her collection contains many leaflets, pamphlets, and serial issues published by the anti-war movement, including ephemeral titles. It also contains a number of letters written by Hilger to various politicians, including several United States senators and Congressional representatives.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Frances E. Hilger collection, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1979.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Active in movement against the Vietnam War

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The Frances E. Hilger collection relates to the political activism of Hilger, an opponent of the Vietnam War. A lifelong Quaker, Hilger participated in several peace groups in the New Jersey area. Her collection contains many leaflets, pamphlets, and serial issues published by the anti-war movement, including ephemeral titles. It also contains a number of letters written by Hilger to various politicians, including several United States senators and Congressional representatives. In addition, there is correspondence relating to other members of Hilger's peace group.

did.unittitle: New York Times (John B. Oakes, James Reston, Kalman Seigel, William Shannon, C. L. Sulzberger),
WMCA (Fred Gale, Robert E. Grant, R. Peter Straus),
Writing on Friends Committee on National Legislation,
Writing on article by Stanley Ellin,
Writing on American flag and peace,
Writing on politics and Quaker religion,
Writing on the Society of Friends,
Writing on William F. Buckley and Daniel Berrigan,
Coalition for a New Foreign and Military Policy,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: See also separate folders for Brazil and Chile.

did.unittitle: National Action/Research on the Military Industrial Complex (NARMIC),
Women's International League for Peace and Freedom,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Largely relates to the Vietnam War and anti-war movement.
